title: 1938 New Zealand rugby league season
text:
The 1938 New Zealand rugby league season was the 31st season of <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> that had been played in New Zealand.
International competitions.
<a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">New Zealand</a> toured Australia, playing in no Test matches. For this tour the <a href="New%20Zealand%20Rugby%20League">New Zealand Rugby League</a> officially adopted the name the "<a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">New Zealand national rugby league team</a>" and added a white V onto their black jerseys for the first time. The Kiwis finished the tour with five wins, one draw and three losses. This included a 30–19 victory against <a href="Newcastle%20rugby%20league%20team">Newcastle</a>. New Zealand were coached by <a href="Thomas%20McClymont">Thomas McClymont</a> and captained by Newton's <a href="Bill%20McNeight">Bill McNeight</a>. The squad included <a href="Jack%20Hemi">Jack Hemi</a>, <a href="Jack%20Smith%20%28rugby%20league%2C%20New%20Zealand%29">Jack Smith</a>, <a href="Rangi%20Chase%20%281937%29">Rangi Chase</a>, <a href="Gordon%20Midgley">Gordon Midgley</a>, <a href="Arthur%20Kay%20%28rugby%20league%29">Arthur Kay</a>, <a href="Clarry%20McNeil">Clarry McNeil</a>, <a href="Wally%20Tittleton">Wally Tittleton</a>, <a href="Wilfred%20Brimble">Wilfred</a> and <a href="Walter%20Brimble">Walter Brimble</a>, vice-captain <a href="Ray%20Brown%20%28New%20Zealand%29">Ray Brown</a>, <a href="Jack%20McLeod%20%28rugby%20league%29">Jack McLeod</a>, <a href="Billy%20Glynn%20%28rugby%20league%29">Billy Glynn</a>, <a href="John%20Anderson%20%28rugby%20league%29">John Anderson</a>, <a href="Des%20Herring">Des Herring</a>, <a href="Angus%20Gault">Angus Gault</a>, <a href="Jack%20Satherley">Jack Satherley</a>, <a href="Harold%20Tetley">Harold Tetley</a>, <a href="George%20Orman">George Orman</a>, <a href="Joe%20Cootes">Joe Cootes</a> and <a href="Jack%20Brodrick">Jack Brodrick</a>.
The <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20Rugby%20League">New South Wales Rugby League</a>'s <a href="Eastern%20Suburbs%20Roosters">Eastern Suburbs Roosters</a> traveled to Auckland, losing to the <a href="Richmond%20Bulldogs">Richmond Bulldogs</a> 11–9 at <a href="Carlaw%20Park">Carlaw Park</a>.
National competitions.
Northern Union Cup.
<a href="West%20Coast%20rugby%20league%20team">West Coast</a> again held the <a href="Northern%20Union%20Cup">Northern Union Cup</a> at the end of the season. They defeated <a href="Canterbury%20rugby%20league%20team">Canterbury</a> 19–15 to retain the trophy.
Inter-district competition.
<a href="Auckland%20rugby%20league%20team">Auckland</a> defeated <a href="Canterbury%20rugby%20league%20team">Canterbury</a> 28–22 at <a href="Carlaw%20Park">Carlaw Park</a>.
The <a href="Canterbury%20rugby%20league%20team">Canterbury</a> player-coach was <a href="Ray%20Brown%20%28New%20Zealand%29">Ray Brown</a>, who had returned from <a href="Barrow%20Raiders">Barrow</a>. The team also included <a href="Len%20Brown%20%28rugby%20league%29">Len Brown</a>. Auckland included <a href="Jack%20Hemi">Jack Hemi</a> and <a href="Rangi%20Chase%20%281937%29">Rangi Chase</a>.
Club competitions.
Auckland.
<a href="Marist%20Saints">Marist Brothers</a> won the <a href="Auckland%20Rugby%20League">Auckland Rugby League</a>'s Fox Memorial Trophy. <a href="Richmond%20Bulldogs">Richmond</a> won the Roope Rooster, Stormont Shield and Norton Cup while <a href="Otahuhu%20Leopards">Otahuhu</a> won the Sharman Cup.
Newton played a home and away series with a Canterbury XIII selection. Newton, who included Mt Albert's Bob Banham, drew 16-all with Canterbury XIII at Monica Park in July. They hosted Canterbury XIII three weeks later, winning 22–12.
Richmond included <a href="Jack%20Satherley">Jack Satherley</a>. <a href="Bob%20Banham">Bob Banham</a> joined the <a href="Mount%20Albert%20Lions">Mount Albert Lions</a> as player-coach from the <a href="South%20Sydney%20Rabbitohs">South Sydney Rabbitohs</a>. He was brought over with some assistance from the Auckland and New Zealand Rugby League.
Wellington.
Petone won the <a href="Wellington%20Rugby%20League">Wellington Rugby League</a>'s Appleton Shield.
Canterbury.
Linwood won the <a href="Canterbury%20Rugby%20League">Canterbury Rugby League</a>'s Massetti Cup.
Rakaia was formed with the help of <a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">New Zealand international</a> <a href="Ces%20Davison">Ces Davison</a>. Due to the distance, the club paid a travel subsidy to travelling teams. Two other Rakaia players, <a href="Jack%20Campbell%20%28rugby%20league%29">Jack Campbell</a> and <a href="George%20Bellaney">George Bellaney</a>, were to become New Zealand representatives in 1939.
Other Competitions.
The <a href="Ngongotaha%20Chiefs">Ngongotaha club</a> was founded in 1938.
Addington defeated the Waratah club from Inangahua 40–19 to retain the <a href="Thacker%20Shield">Thacker Shield</a>.
